page.title: 09EGGINTON CHURCH
page.content: Egginton Church was built in 1290 and the first Rector was John Hebto. The church used to have a steeple but now only has a tower. The oldest grave is dated 1715, and the newest is 1984. The path leading up to the Church is in memory of Mr. Archer, a great Christian. The tower is about 12m tall and the main part is 8m tall. There are several trees leading up to the Church,some are Maple and some are Lime.There are about 250 grave stones in the Church yard. The Oil lamp still works but is only connected to gas at Christmas. The architecture of the church is old English, except for the tower which is Norman.
